content:
Are you offline?

TB menu bar > File > Offline

(If you don't see the menu bar on top, press the ALT key.)

Or the little button on the status bar at the bottom left side.

Also see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1013543.
creator: siffemoz

content:
I found the problem

The 'Density' switch had been altered from Default to Compact

I will make due allowance that this may have been self inflicted, but I have serious doubts that happened.


Density can be found by clicking the three horizontal bars in top right hand corner... Density is a few names down the list... three choices there between compact, default and relaxed.

The answer found at : https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1360794 ....is worth a try....but the density needs to be checked FIRST.

Brian
creator: condobloke1

content:
What is needed is a screenshot of the account folder. To do that, follow these steps:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder'
  3. from there, click the Mail folder and from there the POP account folder
  4. now you should see the folder with input, sent and other folders of the account. do a screenshot of that
  5. while there, click the Mail\Local Folders folder and do a screenshot of that.

Those two screenshots should be a good start to assess where the space is being used. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
Anche in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi? -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird

Comunque se davvero hai oltre 300 GB di email in quel profilo, è inevitabile che Thunderbird sia lento già di suo. Poi magari sono tutte concentrate in poche cartelle pesanti e magari c'è pure l'antivirus che vuole esaminare questi file ogni volta...
creator: @next

content:
The easiest way, assuming you have access to the old profile is this:

  1. cllick tools>import>import from a file
  2. then follow the addressbook menus to the'sqlite' option
  3. click that and then locate 'abook.sqlite' on the old profile to import'
  4. following that, repeat the process for 'history.sqlite' (these are your 'collected addresses')
creator: davidsk
